docs.title: Welcome to the SODAS Documentation
docs.text: Find relevant documentation and information about SODAS here.

docs.title: Server
docs.text:
Welcome to the SODAS server.

Before you start using the server, please make sure that you read all the pages in this part of the documentation.

docs.title: Access
docs.text: In order to access the server, you need to have an account. Contact TBD with your basic information and SODAS affiliation, and they will walk you through the process.

docs.title: Connecting to the server
docs.text: You can connect to the server using SSH, either through the terminal or vscode.

docs.title: SSH
docs.text:
ssh -L <local-port>:localhost:<remote-port> <username>@sodascomp01fl.unicph.domain

To connect locally to the server on port 8000 with the user abc123, do:

ssh -L 8000:localhost:8000 abc123@sodascomp01fl.unicph.domain

Once you have a connection established, you can host a jupyter lab server on the server and connect to it from your local machine.

docs.title: Transfer from local to server
docs.text:
scp /path/to/file <username>@sodascomp01fl.unicph.domain:/path/to/destination

To move a text file in documents to your H-drive which is mounted on the server by default, do:

scp /documents/test.txt abc123@sodascomp01fl.unicph.doman:/ucph/hdir

docs.title: Transfer file from server to local
docs.text:
scp <username>@sodascomp01fl.unicph.domain:/path/to/file /path/to/destination

To move a text file from the H-drive on the server to your local documents folder, do:

scp abc123@sodascomp01fl.unicph.doman:/ucph/hdir/test.txt /documents

docs.title: SSH Config
docs.text:
Create a config file at ~/.ssh/config and add the following lines:

Host github.com
    HostName ssh.github.com
    PreferredAuthentications publickey
    IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
    Port 443
